business.headline: Should you hold or sell NSDL shares after stock market listing? Details hereWhile NSDL may not offer sharp near-term upside post listing, many analysts see it as a core holding in India's market infrastructure play, particularly as digital finance expands and retail participation deepens.

NSDL shares debut with 10% premium over IPO issue priceNSDL's Rs 4,012 crore initial public offering was entirely an offer for sale (OFS) involving 5.01 crore equity shares. The issue saw robust demand from all investor segments, with an overall subscription of 41.02 times.

RBI keeps key lending rate steady at 5.5% amid global trade uncertaintyThe RBI MPC sighted the global tensions and trade uncertainty in keeping key lending rates unchanged. The MPC also decided to continue with a neutral stance.

Sensex, Nifty off to shaky start amid Trump tariff threat, RBI rate decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 65.70 points to 80.644.34 at 9:40 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 28.40 points to trade at 24,620.

RBI MPC announcement today: Will your home loan get cheaper?With interest rates already lowered three times in 2025, homebuyers and borrowers across the country are waiting to see if there is any further relief coming their way.
RBI MPC rate decision on August 6: Time, expectations, and key updatesRBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra will present the monetary policy statement today. Check time, expectations, and key updates.

Anil Ambani likely to be summoned again by ED for questioning: SourcesAnil Ambani faced questioning by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with an alleged Rs 17,000 crore loan fraud case. The questioning lasted for several hours, with sources indicating that he is likely to be summoned again within seven to ten days.

Anil Ambani seeks 10 days from ED to provide documents in fraud cases: SourcesThe 66-year-old industrialist was summoned to the ED headquarters in New Delhi, where his statement was recorded under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

Want higher FD returns? Compare these 1-year rates before investingAmong the different time periods you can choose, a one-year FD is especially attractive. It gives you decent interest without locking up your money for too long.

Why Estonia is the new favourite for Indian startupsAccording to an investment banker, top business leaders have already adopted Estonia's unique e-residency, allowing them to do business across Europe.

Sensex ends over 308 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Titan up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex ended the session 308.47 points lower at 80,710.25, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 73.20 points to settle at 24,649.55. All the broader market indices ended the trading session in negative territory after Trump said he would impose more tariffs on India over Russian oil imports.
How one tax mistake could have cost a real estate seller Rs 1.87 lakhReal estate sellers often ignore deductions that can help reduce capital gains tax.

entertainment.headline: Rubina Dilaik backs Deepika Padukone's demand for fixed work hours: Not unrealisticActor Rubina Dilaik came out in support of Deepika Padukone's demand for fixed eight-hour workdays, calling it a much-needed change in the industry. She shared her own struggles with long working hours and said she would implement better systems if she ever turns producer.
Priyanka Chopra shares cryptic post on disrespect. Can you relate?Priyanka Chopra recently shared a cryptic Instagram Story about cutting off people who disrespect her.

Samay Raina and Apoorva Mukhija spoof their past in funny new adSamay Raina and Apoorva Mukhija have reunited for a quirky skincare ad with their witty banter and playful jabs. The ad went live on Samay's Instagram handle on Tuesday night.

Daavudi to Hrudayam Lopala: Are songs becoming a burden to Telugu cinema?From the removal of the much-loved 'Hrudayam Lopala' in 'Kingdom' to viral tracks like 'Daavudi' in 'Devara Part 1' and 'Pippi Pippi Dum Dum' in 'Kuberaa' being left out of final cuts, this growing trend signals a shift in how music fits into mainstream storytelling.

Mahavatar Narsimha box office Day 12: Historic run continues for top animated hitDirector Ashwin Kumar's 'Mahavatar Narsimha' is not showing any signs of slowing down at the box office. The film surpassed the Rs 100 crore-mark (nett) at the box office in India and is still holding strong.

Women feared me off-screen too, says actor Gulshan GroverGulshan Grover, famously known as Bollywood's 'Bad Man', revealed how his villainous roles once created real-life misconceptions, especially among women. He will be seen next in 'Heer Express'.

Ozzy Osbourne died of cardiac arrest and Parkinson's, cause of death report filedOzzy Osbourne died due to cardiac complications linked to Parkinson's disease. His daughter, Aimee Osbourne, filed his death certificate in London.

Sara Ali Khan heartbroken over Uttarkashi cloudburst: Praying for safety, healingA cloudburst-triggered flash floods hit Uttarkashi, causing fatalities and destruction in Uttarkhand. Actor Sara Ali Khan was distraught seeing the visual and expressed her condolences on Instagram.
VMAs 2025: Lady Gaga leads, Ed Sheeran's Sapphire, Rose, Jimin nominatedLady Gaga leads 2025 MTV VMA nominations with 12 nods, followed by Bruno Mars. Voting opens ahead of the September 7 broadcast.

Mohit Suri on making Saiyaara over Aashiqui 3: No pressure of sequel, opening dayDirector Mohit Suri reveals why he did not direct Aashiqui 3 and shares insights about making Saiyaara. He highlights the freedom from sequel pressure and praises Anurag Basu for taking over the project.

Mahavatar Narsimha OTT release: Makers urge fans to stay away from rumoursMahavatar Narsimha is currently playing exclusively in theatres worldwide with no OTT deal finalised. The makers urge audiences to trust only official updates amid OTT release rumours.

Aanand L Rai, Dhanush to take legal action over Raanjhanaa's AI-altered endingAanand L Rai recently shared how the team is thinking to adopting the legal route for the AI-altered version of their film 'Raanjhanaa'. Their current concern is the unauthorised modification of the film that has created a buzz around.

Hrithik Roshan explains why he rejected 3 Idiots, Dil Chahta Hai. WatchBollywood actor Hrithik Roshan reflects on the missed chances and praises Aamir Khan's performance in various films like '3 Idiots' and 'Dil Chahta Hai'. He is now looking forward to an exciting new chapter with his upcoming projects.

Jr NTR speaks legacy, and why he pushes his sons to write their own future scriptWhile Jr NTR awaits the release of 'War 2', he speaks in an interview about his family's legacy, the future of his children, and what he wants to be remembered for.
Kannada actor Santhosh Balaraj dies at 34 after battling jaundiceKannada actor Santhosh Balaraj died on Tuesday in Bengaluru. He was undergoing treatment for jaundice for several weeks.

Is BTS' Jungkook teaming up with Charlie Puth again? J-Hope suggests soBTS members are currently in the United States working on a new album alongside talented producers and composers, with the release scheduled for 2026. A new video shared by J-Hope hints at a potential collaboration between Jungkook and Charlie Puth.

You've taken it too far, says Hrithik Roshan as Jr NTR sends War 2 actor a billboardThe playful challenge between actors Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR escalated on August 5, when Roshan revealed that Jr NTR had sent a billboard to his home. Responding to the gesture, Roshan joked that the challenge had gone too far and hinted at a comeback.

Farhan Akhtar backs Raanjhanaa director amid AI row: My loyalty lies with creatorFarhan Akhtar shared his views on the AI-altered version of Aanand L Rai and Dhanush's film, 'Raanjhanaa'. The actor extended his support to the creativity of the film.

5 powerful teen dramas that explore real struggles beyond high schoolTeen dramas aren't just about crushes and cliches any more. These shows dive deep into the real, raw challenges of growing up today.

general news.headline: After deadly Uttarakhand flash flood, landslides cut off key roads; rescue ops hitRescue operations in Uttarkashi have been severely hampered by continuous rain. The Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for heavy rain today in several districts of the state.

RBI keeps key lending rate steady at 5.5% amid global trade uncertaintyThe RBI MPC sighted the global tensions and trade uncertainty in keeping key lending rates unchanged. The MPC also decided to continue with a neutral stance.

Trump was asked about US's uranium buys from Russia. Here's his responseIndia said that the United States continues to import key materials from Russia, including uranium hexafluoride for its nuclear industry, palladium for electric vehicles, as well as fertilisers and chemicals.

Trump is Making China Cheaper AgainTrump's tariff of up to 40% on transshipped goods and levies across Southeast Asia has left China a winner. Manufacturers and exporters are asking why they should move out of China. Ironically, Trump's trade war might be doing the unthinkable — making Chinese factories and products cheaper.

Uttarkashi Ground Zero: Key road to Dharali washed out, rescue teams strandedOver four people have died and several are missing as a devastating flash flood swept away hotels and shops in Uttarkashi's Dharali, a popular tourist spot.

Live: 130 rescued so far, bad weather halts choppers from reaching landslide siteUttarkashi Cloudburst Live: At least four people died and several others went missing after a cloudburst triggered flash floods in Uttarkashi's Dharali area on Tuesday. Rescue teams from the police, Army, NDRF, and SDRF were deployed. Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami cut short his Andhra Pradesh visit and returned to Dehradun to review the situation at the State Emergency Operation Centre. He said 130 people stranded in affected areas had been shifted to safer locations, and instructions were issued for immediate food, shelter and medical aid. Additional Army helicopters have been requested to speed up rescue efforts. Schools and educational institutions remain closed in multiple districts. Follow indiatoday.in for all Live Updates.

Lacks basic gratitude: Kalyan Banerjee regrets backing Mahua Moitra in pastKalyan Banerjee reignited his feud with Mahua Moitra, accusing her of ingratitude and abuse, a day after resigning as Lok Sabha chief whip of the Trinamool Congress.
Ajit Doval in Moscow amid Trump's fresh tariff threat for Russia oil buysAccording to a source, the visit is part of a planned schedule and will focus on defence cooperation between India and Russia.

From 4–1 to 2–2: How England let a glorious Test series win slip awayThe Test series between England and India ended in a 2-2 draw, but the hosts could well have won it 4-1. Having squandered golden opportunities for victory at Old Trafford and the Kennington Oval, England now must face the harsh reality of making some big changes with the Ashes on the horizon.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

Don't burn ties with India: Nikki Haley on Trump's tariff threat over Russian oilThe Republican leader also called out the Trump administration's duplicity, highlighting a soft-handling of trade with China in which the US paused the tariffs for 90 days.

Won't call: Brazil president Lula responds to Trump's 'he will call me' remarkThe remark comes amid intensifying diplomatic tensions between the two nations over Washington's decision to impose a 50% tariff on Brazilian imports.

Six years after Article 370: What would statehood change for J&K?The extensive discretion and powers granted to the LG, as the administrator representing the President, will be removed. The authority over police, law and order, bureaucratic transfers, and anti-corruption agencies will return to the elected government.

Trump is hitting India to show MAGA he's hitting RussiaDonald Trump vowed to keep America out of wars, but the Ukraine conflict has left that promise in tatters. Now, by slapping tariffs on India, he is trying to convince MAGA that he is acting against Russia, even though the move does little beyond raising costs at home and straining ties with New Delhi.

Trump's White House rooftop moment: A walk and nuclear missile quipUS President Donald Trump made a surprise appearance on the White House rooftop, chatting with reporters, touring with an architect, and joking about nuclear missiles.

Video: MNS workers storm Nagpur bank, assault staff for action against labourerA video of the MNS workers slapping a staff member, raising slogans, defacing the bank premises and creating a ruckus has gone viral on social media.

Mukesh Kumar is a bowler for all formats: Ganguly on pacer's England Test snubFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly said that Mukesh Kumar is well-suited to bowl across all three formats and backed the pacer to be in contention for a spot in India's squad for the 2025 Asia Cup.

Why FAFO parenting is blowing up right nowStepping away from gentle parenting, many parents are now leaning toward the FAFO approach, a style that lets kids learn through real-world consequences instead of endless reminders and warnings.

Live: Parliament resumes day after disruptions over Bihar voter roll rowParliament Monsoon Session 2025 Live Updates: Both Houses will reconvene today following repeated adjournments amid continued Opposition protests over the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar. On Tuesday, the Rajya Sabha passed a resolution to extend President's Rule in Manipur, even as Opposition MPs staged protests demanding a discussion on the electoral roll revision issue. Meanwhile, the Lok Sabha cleared its first bill of the Monsoon Session — a proposal to grant reservation to Scheduled Tribes in the Goa Legislative Assembly. The passage came despite disruptions, as Opposition parties continued their protests for the tenth consecutive day over a range of contentious issues. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

All three men remain in contention despite the West Indies Test series later on in September.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
